conclusion: The x-axis represents time (t) in seconds. The y-axis represents velocity (v) in meters per second (m/s). The slope of the v-t graph gives the acceleration of the particle.
The time interval of interest is from t = 1 s to t = 3 s. During this interval, the graph shows a straight line with a negative slope.
At t = 1 s, the velocity is v1 = 2 m/s. At t = 3 s, the velocity is v2 = -2 m/s.
The change in velocity (Δv) is Δv = v2 - v1 = -2 m/s - 2 m/s = -4 m/s.
The change in time (Δt) is Δt = t2 - t1 = 3 s - 1 s = 2 s.
Acceleration (a) is given by the formula: a = Δv / Δt = -4 m/s / 2 s = -2 m/s².
